SENT.plain: We present a patient with Burkitt's lymphoma in whom the initial diagnostic lumbar puncture was difficult due to a recent lumbar laminectomy and residual spinal cord tumor
According to our current protocol, he was to receive intrathecal chemotherapy for three consecutive days

To avoid the need for repeated attempts at lumbar puncture and to ensure the proper instillation of therapy, a percutaneous IT catheter was placed for 48 hours and the three doses of IT chemotherapy were administered through this catheter
Due to the importance of IT chemotherapy, options must be available to deliver these medications when technical or anatomic abnormalities exist
One such option is the short term placement of a percutaneous IT catheter
